title: Readers/Writers should have equivalent of Good() method
body:
by **cyril.zorin**: 
At the moment, doing IO in a loop requires latching on to the "err" value
returned from various 
functions to determine whether or not the IO operations succeeded, and whether or not to
continue 
the loop.

It would be much more convenient if readers and writers had a Good() method (just like
in C++'s 
iostream), so that one could write: for connection.good() { ... do stuff ... }
